title: Narrative Practice
goal: Narrate a full day using all tense tools.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 10 vocabulary words:

day → ?       morning → ?
week → ?      evening → ?
month → ?     night → ?
year → ?      time → ?
hour → ?      date → ?

(Answers: djedi, cerni, jeftu, vanci, masti, nicte, nanca, temci, cacra, detri)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

Tense Tools

Type Cmavo Examples
Simple tense pu, ca, ba past, present, future
Contour co'a, ca'o, mo'u, co'u begin, ongoing, complete, stop
Duration ze'i, ze'a, ze'u short, medium, long

Combinations

Example Meaning
puca'o was ongoing
baco'a will begin
pumo'u had completed
pu ze'a for a while (past)

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (10 points)

Translate:

  1. djedi →
  2. cerni →
  3. vanci →
  4. nicte →
  5. cacra →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. week →
  2. month →
  3. year →
  4. time →
  5. date →
Answers
  1. day
  2. morning
  3. evening
  4. night
  5. hour
  6. jeftu
  7. masti
  8. nanca
  9. temci
  10. detri

Part B: Tense (10 points)

What does each mean?

  1. mi pu klama →
  2. mi ca citka →
  3. mi ba sipna →
  4. mi co'a gunka →
  5. mi ca'o tcidu →

Translate:

  1. I was eating. → ?
  2. I will start working. → ?
  3. I finished writing. → ?
  4. I sleep briefly. → ?
  5. I work for a long time. → ?
Answers
  1. I went
  2. I am eating now
  3. I will sleep
  4. I begin working
  5. I am reading (ongoing)
  6. mi puca'o citka
  7. mi baco'a gunka
  8. mi mo'u ciska
  9. mi ze'i sipna
  10. mi ze'u gunka

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Narrate Your Day

Use at least:

  • Two simple tenses (pu/ca/ba)
  • Two contours (co'a/ca'o/mo'u)
  • One duration (ze'i/ze'a/ze'u)
  • Two day-part words

Example:

mi pu cerni cu co'a sipna
.i mi pu ze'a ca'o sipna
.i mi pu mo'u sipna
.i ca mi ca'o gunka
.i mi ba vanci cu mo'u gunka
.i mi ba nicte cu sipna

(I began sleeping in the morning. I was sleeping for a while. I finished sleeping. Now I am working. I will finish working in the evening. I will sleep at night.)

Create your own and say it aloud.

Summary

You completed Week 15 on tense. You can now express past, present, future, event phases, and duration.

Next week preview: Week 16 introduces negation — na, na'e, to'e, no'e.
